FuncDef:
The access user-group-list command binds a user group load balancing group to a domain.
The undo access user-group-list command unbinds a user group load balancing group from a domain.
By default, no user group load balancing group is bound to a domain.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a user group load balancing group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To distribute the traffic of users who go online through the same domain to different centralized CGN devices based on the user group weight, you need to configure a user group load balancing group, add user groups (each with a weight) to the user group load balancing group, and run the access user-group-list command to bind the user group load balancing group to the domain.
Prerequisites
A user group load balancing group has been created using the access user-group-list (system view) command.
Precautions
Only one user group load balancing group can be bound to a domain.
The same user group load balancing group can be bound to different domains.
A user group that is not bound to a NAT instance and a user group load balancing group are mutually exclusive in the same domain.
